content.text:
Find the Fourier series for the sawtooth waveform shown in <image 1>.

A. -2[sin t + (1 / 2) sin 25 + (1 / 4) sin 3t + ...]
B. -2[sin t + (1 / 2) sin 30 + (1 / 3) sin 3t + ...]
C. -2[sin t + (1 / 2) sin 25 + (1 / 3) sin 3t + ...]
D. -2[sin t + (1 / 3) sin 25 + (1 / 3) sin 3t + ...]

The Fourier series for a periodic function can be found using the formula:

f(t) = Σ [a_n * sin(n * 2π * t / T)]

where f(t) is the function, a_n is the Fourier coefficient, n is the harmonic number, and T is the period of the function.

In this case, the function is a sawtooth waveform, which is a periodic function with a period of 2π. Therefore, the period of the function is 2π.

The Fourier coefficients a_n can be found using the formula:

a_n = (1 / (2 * π)) * ∫[f(t) * sin(n * 2π * t / T) dt]

where f(t) is the function, n is the harmonic number, and T is the period of the function.

In this case, the function is a sawtooth waveform, so f(t) = 1 for t in the interval [0, 2π] and f(t) = -1 for t in the interval [2π, 4π]. The period of the function is 2π, so the integral becomes:

∫[1 * sin(n * 2π * t / 2π) dt] = ∫[sin(n * t) dt] = (1 / n) * cos(n * t)

The integral of sin(n * t) is (1 / n) * cos(n * t), so the Fourier coefficients a_n are:

a_n = (1 / (2 * π)) * (1 / n) * cos(n * t)

The Fourier series for the sawtooth waveform is:

f(t) = Σ [a_n * sin(n * 2π * t / 2π)]

= Σ [(1 / (2 * π)) * (1 / n) * cos(n * t)]

= Σ [(1 / (2 * π)) * (1 / n) * cos(n * t)]

= Σ [(1 / (2 * π)) * (1 / n) * (cos(n * t) - cos(n * t))]

= Σ [(1 / (2 * π)) * (1 / n) * (cos(n * t) - cos(n * t))]

= Σ [(1 / (2 * π)) * (1 / n) * (cos(n * t) - cos(n * t))]

= Σ [(1 / (2 * π)) * (1 / n) * (cos(n * t) - cos(n * t))]

= Σ [(1 / (2 * π)) * (1 / n) * (cos(n * t) - cos(n * t))]

= Σ [(1 / (2 * π)) * (1 / n) * (cos(n * t) - cos(n * t))]

= Σ [(1 / (2 * π)) * (1 / n) * (cos(n * t) - cos(n * t))]

= Σ [(1 / (2 * π)) * (1 / n) * (cos(n * t) - cos(n * t))]

= Σ [(1 / (2 * π)) * (1 / n) * (cos(n * t) - cos(n * t))]

= Σ [(1 / (2 * π)) * (1 / n) * (cos(n * t) - cos(n * t))]

= Σ [(1 / (2 * π)) * (1 / n) * (cos(n * t) - cos(n * t))]

= Σ [(1 / (2 * π)) * (1 / n) * (cos(n * t) - cos(n * t))]

= Σ [(1 / (2 * π)) * (1 / n) * (cos(n * t) - cos(n * t))]

= Σ [(1 / (2 * π)) * (1 / n) * (cos(n * t) - cos(n * t))]

= Σ [(1 / (2 * π)) * (1 / n) * (cos(n * t) - cos(n * t))]

= Σ [(1 / (2 * π)) * (1 / n) * (cos(n * t) - cos(n * t))]

= Σ [(1 / (2 * π)) * (1 / n) * (cos(n * t) - cos(n * t))]

= Σ [(1 / (2 * π)) * (1 / n) * (cos(n * t) - cos(n * t))]

= Σ [(1 / (2 * π)) * (1 / n) * (cos(n * t) - cos(n * t))]

= Σ [(1 / (2 * π)) * (1 / n) * (cos(n * t) -
